attributes.description: This map shows the supply chain for products produced by Dutch brand 100% Organic Cotton.
attributes.title: 100% Organic Cotton

attributes.description:
Maharashtra Organic Cotton Project. 
 
About 90% of the cotton used by 100% Organic Cotton comes from these two cotton farms.  The rest is supplemented by GOTS certified cotton from other local farms.

See http://www.chetnaorganic.org.in/
attributes.title: Chetna Organic Cotton Project

attributes.description: Sewing and Dyeing Mill.  See http://www.rajlakshmi.com/
attributes.address: Acharya Jagadish Chandra Bose Road, Kolkata, West Bengal, India
attributes.title: Rajlakshmi Cotton Mills

attributes.description:
100% Organic Cotton / Fair & Co Headquarters.  

100% Organic Cotton produces a broad range of basics – such as T-shirts and polos – for both women and men. Made from 100% organic cotton and created in a socially responsible production process. 

See verified sustainability information at 
http://www.made-by.org/100percentorganiccotton
attributes.address: Kapelhoek 10, Paardenmaat, 3833 BW Leusden, The Netherlands
attributes.title: HQ: 100% Organic Cotton/Fair&Co
Chetna Organic Cotton Project
attributes.description:
Orissa Organic Cotton Project.

About 90% of the cotton used by 100% Organic Cotton comes from these two cotton farms.  The rest is supplemented by GOTS certified cotton from other local farms.

See http://www.chetnaorganic.org.in/

attributes.title: Pacific Cotspin
attributes.description: Rajlakshmi Cotton Mills uses Pacific Cotspin for spinning the organic cotton into yarn.

attributes.title: Clothing Transport
attributes.description: Clothing is sent from India to the Netherlands, where 100% Organic Cotton has its headquarters.
